title: Dev2Prod - Synchronize aggregated offerings
content:
As a tenant admin, you can also use the Dev2Prod process to synchronize aggregated offerings from one tenant to another, in particular, from a development tenant to a production tenant. 

Note: An aggregated offering is an offering based on a service design in a provider. For example, if you have enabled Design and Deploy (DND) in Service Management as a provider, you can create aggregated offerings. For more information about aggregated offerings, see Create an aggregated offering.

The process for synchronizing aggregated offerings from a source tenant to a target tenant consists of the following steps. Note that you need to export and import service designs and aggregated offerings separately. 

  1. Export service designs from the source tenant
  2. Export aggregated offerings from the source tenant
  3. Import service designs into the target tenant
  4. Create a DND provider in the target tenant
  5. Run a Dev2Prod simulation import for aggregated offerings
  6. Run a real import for aggregated offerings
  7. Verify imported data

Prerequisites

Before you begin, make sure you have met the following prerequisites:

  • Your suite admin has enabled the DND capability for your source and target tenants. 
  • You've obtained the user name and password of the DND admin user from your suite admin. You'll need the information when creating an aggregation provider in the target tenant. 
  • Your target tenant has the following settings ( Administration > Application Settings in the agent portal)
    Setting Value
    Enable Operations Orchestration On
    Enable Service Design and Deployment On
    Enable aggregation On
    Enable a custom entity link between two out-of-the-box record types On

Export service designs from the source tenant

In the source tenant, go to Build > Design. Open each service design associated with an aggregated offering to synchronize, make sure it's published, and then click Export. The system exports each service design to your local drive as a .zip file. For more information, see Import and export a service design.

Export aggregated offerings from the source tenant

In the agent portal, perform the following steps:

  1. Go to Administration > Utilities > Packages to create a new package.
  2. Open the package, and in the Content section click Add to select Service Portfolio/Catalog. The system selects both Configurations and Data for all items by default. You can use a filter to export only the records you want. 
  3. Click OK and then Save.
  4. Click Export. 

Import service designs into the target tenant

In the target tenant, go to Build > Design. On the All Designs page, click the gear icon and select Import Design to import each service design you exported from the source tenant as a .zip file. 

Create an aggregation provider in the target tenant

In the target tenant, create an aggregation provider for DND. This provider must have the same name as the provider in the source tenant. For details, see Create and edit aggregation providers. 

Import the aggregated offerings into the target tenant

First, run a simulation import with the package that you exported from the source tenant:

  1. Go to Administration > Utilities > Packages and select the Options tab.
  2. In the Simulate an import pane, click Simulate to import the package. Make sure the simulation is successful. If any issues, see Error when importing aggregated offerings. 

Then, in the Import a package pane, click Import to run a real import. For details, see Dev2Prod - Synchronize Service Catalog content. 

Verify the imported data

In the target tenant, verify that you have successfully imported the aggregated offerings. You may want to request an aggregated offering from Service Portal and check that the system successfully fulfills your request.
